items.description: File path to the data file. This should be a valid file path in the system where the manifest is being used.
Timestamp of when the data was created or last modified. This should be in ISO 8601 format.
Description of the data file. This should provide a brief overview of the contents of the file.
Type of the data file. This should be the extension of the data file. Such as .txt, .csv, .json, etc.
Type of entity represented in the data file. This should be one of the following: subject, sample, performance, site.
Modality of the data. This should describe the type of data contained in the file, such as 'image', 'text', 'audio', etc.
DOI to the dataset this data is also part of.
Path to the dataset that this data file is part of. This should be a valid file path in the system where the manifest is being used. Should be true or false or empty.
Path to the data dictionary for this data file. This should be a valid file path in the system where the manifest is being used.
Indicates whether the entity represented in this data file is transitive. This should be either true or false.
Additional metadata about the data file. This can include any other relevant information that does not fit into the other categories.
